achieves.from sentence:
Review Sentiment Analysis
The representation learned by our model achieves 91.8 % significantly outperforming the state of the art of 90.2 % by a 30 model ensemble .

outperforms.from sentence: It matches the performance of baselines using as few as a dozen labeled examples and outperforms all previous results with only a few hundred labeled examples .

does not reach.from sentence: Confusingly , despite a 16 % relative error reduction on the binary subtask , it does not reach the state of the art of 53.6 % on the fine - grained subtask , achieving 52.9 % .

L1 regularization.from sentence:
L1 regularization is known to reduce sample complexity when there are many irrelevant features .
Fitting a threshold to this single unit achieves a test accuracy of 92.30 % which outperforms a strong supervised results on the dataset , the 91.87 % of NB - SVM trigram , but is still below the semi-supervised state of the art of 94.09 % .

full 4096 unit representation.from sentence: Using the full 4096 unit representation achieves 92.88 % .

approach.from sentence:
Capacity Ceiling
We try our approach on the binary version of the Yelp Dataset Challenge in 2015 as introduced in .

full dataset.from sentence: Using the full dataset , we achieve 95 . 22 % test accuracy .

capacity ceiling.from sentence: The observed capacity ceiling is an interesting phenomena and stumbling point for scaling our unsupervised representations .

notable drop.from sentence: Additionally , there is a notable drop in the relative performance of our approach transitioning from sentence to document datasets .

labeled data.from sentence: Finally , as the amount of labeled data increases , the performance of the simple linear model we train on top of our static representation will eventually saturate .
